\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{tcp\_acceptor}{tcp\_acceptor}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{tcp__acceptor_8h_a4d335515039bbcb41e9a68a7c46c148c} 
using \mbox{\hyperlink{tcp__acceptor_8h_a4d335515039bbcb41e9a68a7c46c148c}{sockpp\+::tcp\+\_\+acceptor}} = acceptor\+\_\+tmpl$<$tcp\+\_\+socket$>$}



Class for creating a TCP server. 

Objects of this class bind and listen on TCP ports for incoming connections. Normally, a server thread creates one of these and blocks on the call to accept incoming connections. The call to accept creates and returns a tcp\+\_\+socket which can then be used for the actual communications.
